page.title: 03News in Clayton-le-Woods: 1
page.content:
Chorley Guardian 20:6:1985
The future of 300-year-old Buckshaw Hall was said to be in the balance after a special meeting in the Town Hall. It was decided that the historic building should be removed from the ROF grounds but that its upkeep must not become a burden on ratepayers. One possibility was to sell the hall to a private developer who would run it as a restaurant. Euxton parish councillors are anxious to see the hall kept in public ownership and open to visitors. The Central Lancashire Development Corporation have rejected Euxton Park as a new site but although councillors are looking at other possibilities it is still hoped this will be the final home of the 17th century house.
